intro: Annickia kwiluensis, commonly known as the Kwiluensis Annickia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, clustered flowers with four petals. It is typically found in moist, shaded forest environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and understudied species.
